1560862969_1FqSXCYG7aTFqtAbtRi1qQ7ZEprgp.body:
I'm running several experimental services, including ZeroNet. My rationale is preparing alternative platforms so that we're ready when the Internet has become unusable -- won't take more than a few years now.

What I like about decentralized platforms like this one is that it's a lot faster, due to coming from the local server or even localhost, bypassing the TCP/IP stack altogether.

Oh, and since you said

> I don't see those many censorable contents.

in many so-called democractic, free Western countries you no longer can speak about political issues online without censorship and persecution of opinions outside the Overton window https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overton_window . As such self-hosted, semi-anonymous or anonymous (Tor hidden services based) platforms allow people to speak freely, without having to self-censor or fear persecution.
